xxl.core.util
Class XXLSystem

java.lang.Object
  xxl.core.util.XXLSystem

public class XXLSystem
extends Object

The XXLSystem class contains system related methods. For example there are two static methods to determine the memory size of an object. It cannot be instantiated.

See Also:
HashSet, Set, Array, Field, Modifier

          This class is a Wrapper for objects with the intention to distinguish two objects if and only if they refer to the same object.

Field Detail

NULL

public static final PrintStream NULL
The "standard" null stream. This stream is already open and ready to accept output data. Typically this stream corresponds to suppress any display output. This stream fills the gap in System providing "only" standard print streams for standard out and errors but no "null sink". See the println methods in class PrintStream.

REFERENCE_MEM_SIZE

public static final int REFERENCE_MEM_SIZE
The size of a reference in memory.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

getObjectSize

public static int getObjectSize(Object object,
                                Set classesExcl,
                                Set fieldsExcl)
                         throws IllegalAccessException
This method computes the memory size of the given object. To get the memory size of the specified object, a reference to this object is needed. If this reference is null, the trivial case, the returned object size is 8 byte, because that is only the size of a reference in memory. Otherwise getObjectSize(Object, Class, Set, Set, Set) is called, which anaylizes the class this object is an instance of, the superclasses and especially the memory size allocated for each non-static and non-transient attribute of these classes is determined and saved in a HashSet. For further information of saving the objects in the HashSet see XXLSystem.Wrapper.

Parameters:
object - the object the memory size is to be determined.
classesExcl - Set of classes which are excluded during counting.
fieldsExcl - Sets of field names which are excluded during counting.
Returns:
the memory size of the specified object.
Throws:
IllegalAccessException
See Also:
getObjectSize(Object, Class, Set, Set, Set)

getObjectSize

public static int getObjectSize(Object object)
                         throws IllegalAccessException
This method computes the memory size of the given object. To get the memory size of the specified object, a reference to this object is needed. If this reference is null, the trivial case, the returned object size is 8 byte, because that is only the size of a reference in memory. Otherwise getObjectSize(Object, Class, Set, Set, Set) is called, which anaylizes the class this object is an instance of, the superclasses and especially the memory size allocated for each non-static and non-transient attribute of these classes is determined and saved in a HashSet. For further information of saving the objects in the HashSet see XXLSystem.Wrapper.

Parameters:
object - the object the memory size is to be determined.
Returns:
the memory size of the specified object.
Throws:
IllegalAccessException
See Also:
getObjectSize(Object, Class, Set, Set, Set)

getObjectSize

protected static int getObjectSize(Object object,
                                   Class cl,
                                   Set hs,
                                   Set classesExcl,
                                   Set fieldsExcl)
                            throws IllegalAccessException
The size of an object is computed recursively, by determining the attributes of the class the object is an instance of. The algorithm starts with the reference memory size of 8 byte that is allocated for each object to hold the reference on it. Then the attributes (fields) of the class and the super classes are determined with regard to the object to be analyzed. If an attribute is a primitive type the size is added to the reference memory size.
If it is an array the size of the array's component type is computed and then multiplied with the length of the array. The resulting value is added to the reference size allocated for this array and at last 4 bytes are added needed to save the length information of an array.
Otherwise the attribute is an object and the method is called recursively adding the size of this attribute to the previous computed object size.

Overview:

primitive types:

  • int, float : 4 byte
  • byte, boolean: 1 byte
  • char, short: 2 byte
  • long, double: 8 byte

size of a reference in memory: 8 byte

size of an array: 

 8 byte (reference)
 + 4 byte (length information (int))
 + (array.length * bytes allocated component type)
All traversed attributes are inserted in a HashSet, which represents an exact image of the allocated memory concerning the given object.

Note: This HashSet is a non-cyclic graph.

Parameters:
object - the object the memory size is to be determined.
cl - the class the object to be analyzed is an instance of.
hs - the HashSet used to store the traversed attributes.
classesExcl - Set of classes which are excluded during counting.
fieldsExcl - Sets of field names which are excluded during counting.
Returns:
the memory size of the specified object.
Throws:
IllegalAccessException

public static Object cloneObject(Object o)

Parameters:
o - to be cloned.
Returns:
the cloned Object.

getOutPath

public static String getOutPath(String[] subdirs)
Constructs a directory inside the outpath with the desired subdirectory. The partial names of the subdirectory have to be passed inside the subdirs array. The path does not have a file separator at the end.

Parameters:
subdirs - partial names of the path
Returns:
whole path (contains a file separator at the end).

getDataPath

public static String getDataPath(String[] subdirs)
Returns a data path inside xxl/data, which points to a certain subdirectory. The partial names of the subdirectory have to be passed inside the subdirs array. The path does not have a file separator at the end.

Parameters:
subdirs - string containing subpath
Returns:
whole path (contains a file separator at the end).

getJavaVersion

public static double getJavaVersion()

Returns:
returns the Java RTE major version number

getValueFromMD

public static Object getValueFromMD(String key,
                                    Object object)
Tries to get a value from the meta data of given object, specified by the key. If the object does not implement the CompositeMetaData interface or the key is not found, null is returned.

Parameters:
key - the specified key
object - an object
Returns:
the value specified by the key.
See Also:
CompositeMetaData

The main method contains some examples for methods of this class.

Parameters:
args - array of String arguments. It can be used to submit parameters when the main method is called.
